comments: Funny professor. Broke a table in my class explaining microphones. Took class during Summer B so it was very quick. Easy class with open notes test and quizzes. Pay attention and print/write notes and you\'ll be fine. There is a video project that can be a pain, but that is the only bad thing. ONLY PROFESSOR TO BREAK A TABLE!!! EPICNESS!!!!

Hilarious professor. Lectures get pretty boring, but he himself is a great teacher and he adds humor to everything he teaches. If you make a name for yourself the first day, he WILL target you for the rest of the semester as the butt of his jokes. Tests are open notes and labs are very easy so this grade is completely reflected off how lazy you are
Hella funny guy. Extremely easy. He\'s kind of a big deal.

Really easy professor, tests are open book. Attendance mandatory. Really flexible on the final project (me story). All around really nice and great professor, knows what he\'s talking about and loves what he does.

Love this teacher he\'s really fun and Makes class interesting. \r He gives open notes quizzes, and takes attendance. \r It\'s a good class to casually learn and not have a lot of stress. \r If you have any trouble he\'s happy to help. \r And save cash cause he doesn\'t have a text book

Totally worth the chili pepper! He glides across the stage like a glorious Lion and teaches with the voracity of a professional ice skater. And I\'m being dead serious, he\'s an amazing teacher that I would take over and over again!
I never saw a grade till the last day, but really easy class. He seems like a nice guy, willing to help if you actually need it.

This guy knows his stuff. He has his own digital media company for freakin sake. The power points can get boring, but he makes it fun. The best teacher at UCF that Ive taken as of yet. Doesnt post grades but its open note tests so its not a big deal unless your an idiot and have bad grades in this class, seriously easy A, take it, bring up your GPA

Funny guy with a real passion and understanding of his field. He knows anything and everything about digital video and audio production. He does take attendance but apparently you can miss a lot of classes before he starts taking points. Open note tests and exams!? What more could you ask for?

He\'s a really nice guy and seems to know a lot. His lecture tend to be a bit hard to sit through (Sorry!), but he will try to bring in props sometimes to keep us entertained. But why, Mr. Gromak, for the love of all things good, would you pick Kenny as a lab instructor for this class?!

Easy class, lectures tend to be a bit boring and on the long side. His system of distributing grades is extremely flawed. I didn\'t even know I was doing bad until after the class was over. He never posts grades online. Be careful.

His digital video fundamentals lectures will put you to sleep, and he knows it so he tries to get your attention by moving around and being goofy. He works from these awful powerpoints with cheesy how to videos that are just sad. He\'s a nice guy, and he seems fairly knowledgeable, however he\'s too eager to stick to the syllabus which sucks.
